subject: EventService : Send event for the host and bmc state change
commitMessage:
EventService : Send event for the host and bmc state change

This commit adds support to send redfish event when
there is a host state change on the url "/redfish/v1/Systems/system"
and bmc state change on the url "/redfish/v1/Managers/bmc"

Tested by: (Used https://github.com/DMTF/Redfish-Event-Listener)
    1. Create a subscription by passing "ResourceTypes" as ["Manager","System"]
       POST -D headers.txt https://${bmc}/redfish/v1/EventService/Subscriptions
       -d '{"Destination" : "https://<host:port>, "ResourceTypes":["Manager","System"], "Protocol":"Redfish"}'
    2. Run a command which change host and bmc state
    3. Verify if the changes are reported as events

BMC state change Event payload :

bodydata:  {"@odata.type":"#Event.v1_4_0.Event","Events":[{"EventId":1,"EventTimestamp":"2020-08-06T13:18:15+00:00","EventType":"ResourceChanged","MemberId":0,"Message":"One or more resource properties have changed.","MessageArgs":null,"MessageId":"ResourceEvent.1.0.3.ResourceChanged","MessageSeverity":"OK","OriginOfCondition":"/redfish/v1/Managers/bmc/PowerState","Severity":"OK"}],"Id":1,"Name":"Event Log"}

Host state event Payload:

bodydata:  {"@odata.type":"#Event.v1_4_0.Event","Events":[{"EventId":30,"EventTimestamp":"2020-08-06T13:16:21+00:00","EventType":"ResourceChanged","MemberId":0,"Message":"One or more resource properties have changed.","MessageArgs":null,"MessageId":"ResourceEvent.1.0.3.ResourceChanged","MessageSeverity":"OK","OriginOfCondition":"/redfish/v1/Systems/system/PowerState","Severity":"OK"}],"Id":30,"Name":"Event Log"}

Signed-off-by: Ravi Teja <raviteja28031990@gmail.com>
Change-Id: Ia34174ad11999372a12707a5ceeeac672b1e074a

How do you expect this to work?   If the BMC is shutting down, can we trust that this is going to get sent at all before bmcweb is shut down?  What is the use case for a bmc power state change event when the connection to the BMC is getting torn down?
say client is registered for bmc state change event, if i do reboot i could see that event received by client while bmc state changed to ready.

The callback handler should not need to recreate the match signal.  This also adds a discontinuity in the match expression, where matches could be missed as one watch is created and another is destroyed.
This feature has nothing to do with IBM management console, and uses the existing Redfish task service, unless I'm missing something, this is the wrong feature flag to use.
i feel this is not implemented proper way yet, its still work in progress
